text: but watch him on this year this funny
tonight we were woken up at 4 o'clock in
the morning and we're forced to work
straightaway
apart from the mealtime breaks we worked
all day long until into the night we
could only stop when the guards told us
to everyone had different jobs some
worked in the fields others in factories
some prisoners were sent to the mines
the aim of the concentration camp was to
have inmates to be constantly working as
a way to repent for their sins we work
from the moment we opened our eyes until
we went to bed in the Bible you read
about heaven and hell and we're in hell
those have to live amongst the flames
that's what the prison camp was like
hell it's the only way I can describe it
to Johnny while living in the camp there
was a rule that we had to report on any
wrongdoings even if it worked to be by
your family members or friends one time
I overheard my mother and brother
talking about escape and I later
reported it as I felt it was part of my
duty at the time until then I called
them as mother and brother but I didn't
really have any special feelings of
kinship or compassion or the concept of
family later both my mother and brother
were publicly executed because of me and
I had to witness their deaths in front
of lots of people after coming to South
Korea as I began to learn how to live a
normal life as I started to become more
like an ordinary person
the guilt overwhelmed me of what I did
to my family and constantly faced with a
burden and trauma it's really hard to
live with the guilt hanging over me so
much I knew I was destined to live and
die in the camp it wasn't like I escaped
to seek freedom because I had no concept
of freedom to begin with I just wanted
to try and have a taste of normal food
what people in the outside ate to be
able to have a full stomach I wanted to
do this even if I got caught and to be
shot to death or to be beaten to death I
just wanted to eat properly that's why I
tried to escape it wasn't easy and in
the process a fellow inmate who ran next
to me died when he got electrocuted by
the perimeter fence and my skin got
burnt as well most inmates don't even
consider escaping they just accepted as
their fate of living inside the camp for
their entire lives
if I hadn't learned of what life was
like outside the camp and heard about
the food they ate I wouldn't be here to
talk about my experiences in the prison
camp because I would still be there
